intro: Timonius wrayi, commonly known as the Wray's timonius, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as philodendrons and calla lilies. The plant is characterized by its striking, arrow-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Timonius wrayi is considered a species of conservation concern.
